This place, for the after-work crowd, generally does that.  Enough flirtation to stay, and just nasty enough to get me to go home after a few drinks.
author: David S.

description:
one of my favorite hang outs.

No it is not a hag bar
Yes it is a mans bar
No it isn't Daddy's anymore :o(
yes it smells
yes the drinks are strong

Me likey!
author: Matt V.

description:
440, what......

Daddies, love me some Daddies.

The place is a great space to grab a drink and maybe grab....

A good ole cruise bar...more SOMA than Castro
author: Ken p.

description:
At first I was highly pissed they changed Daddy's. 

But after a while, I started to embrace the better music, nicer bartenders (love you Nick and the hot Daddy in back), more space, improved lighting and, oh, hotter guys...

...and never looked back!
author: BroSauce J.

description:
I've been here twice. Once after the Pink Party during Pride 2008 and most recently out with friends after a birthday dinner.  Both times I have had different experiences. During Pride it was far to crowed in a good way, took forever to get a drink, but was well worth it based upon the mood and vibe of the crowd. Being a straight girl in a gay bar can be a tricky situation, you either feel loved or extremely out of place.  I totally loved it and had a fabulous time, and was extremely relieved to see that the women's rest room was upstairs and locked rather than the men's room spectacle that would have proved difficult and extremely akward for me.

The bar tenders were gorgeous and freindly and one made me the stongest tequila sunrise I have ever had....always a plus.  Hot go go dancers, and an awesome DJ make this a really cool place to go. If your up for an expereince go here....you may meet a drag queen that'll knock your socks off.
author: Angela C.

description:
Ladies, better be content with being invisible.  The times that I have been here it must have been leave your clothes at home night because several gentlemen were strutting around the bar in nothing but their tiny knickers.

My roommate Emily dragged me in the little gated off section of the stairway to dance and was completely mortified when she noticed that no one was watching us.  Ahem.  Lets' see, we're in the Castro, at a gay bar where men are walking around in their undies...I don't think any gay man would be interested in watching two fully dressed straight women dance...  Just a crazy thought.

The men were fun and outgoing and more than willing to chat us up and talk about their dogs and various other fun, everyday stuff.  I'd definitely recommend this place because the people that frequent it are awesome....I wish I had the guts to talk about my undying love of my dog Snuggles while wearing nothing but a thong and holding a cocktail.  Kudos.
author: Susan C.

description:
Pappa can you hear me?

Apparently not.  It's so sad that the days of Daddy's are gone.  I can still remember being a wee lad of 21 and crossing the street to avoid the oversexed men that paraded inside the dark, smelling bar.  Not too long after I found out why years later I was so drawn to step foot inside.

Daddy's (440 to the newbies) still embraces yester-year with it's iconic man dressed in leather garb cut-out located near the trough upstairs, however these men no longer venture.  You'll find this bar full of every taste of the rainbow from twinks to muscle bears.  You won't find many bikers here, nor those dressed in leather, but you will still have an amazing time.

The bartenders are friendly and have wicked smiles.  Watch the youngster in the upstairs bar, he's more than likely to call you "Mister or Sir" regardless of your age.  Obviously he knows his place on the totem pole (just jokes kiddo).  Music at times here can be a little too Pop and best left at Badlands.

Overall, if you walk into Daddy's with a go with the flow attitude, you're night will treat you well.  It can get a little crowded and warm in this place so just be patient and respect those around you.
author: Shane P.

description:
There's just something missing. The soft core porn videos reek of "trying too hard". The staff is nice enough, but when a 35ish bartender is trying the A&F look,,,,I realize businesses need to make money and use any ploy at their disposal, but REALLY..REALLY? You can tell the owners put some thought into the look of the place, which is nice..but there's just something missing that I can't put my finger on. They get an A for effort though.

Update: 01/18/13: things have settled into a more comfortable groove. The bartendars welcome everyone equally and have a kind of confident sexiness whithout being arrogant. AND they are putting money back into the business by re-doing the back bar area. Good drinks, good men, YAY!
author: David I.

description:
I was here in July of 2007.  Cool space.  I am not into the bear type or those who look my age.  Lets face it, after 30 oil of olay can do wonders, and beer guts are not enticing to the majority and not good for your health.  Lets's get a clue people!   Dudes, take better care of yourselves!   Good place for a lay if you are into this type since I was felt up and groped like when I was 17 and I am 47 now.  
So, whatever.  Great bar for those that like this scene.  Bar staff was excellent, however, they really don't cater to women but I guess that is ok if that is the ONLY gay bar like that.
author: Robert R.

description: Looks like 440 walled off their rear, up the stairs bar making the rear part so much smaller.   I don't get it, it looks horrible and cramped, totally unfriendly looking.   Bummer.
author: Jason B.

description: $2 Beer on Monday any on draft... that's just crazy. Even crazier was the fact it was $2 even, no additional tax or charges.. just two dollars. Nuff said. Has a decent atmosphere, didn't feel stuffy. I visited in the afternoon and they were pretty busy so I can only imagine at night. Like most the establishments in the area its cash only. I will be back for another visit.
author: Zak P.

description: If you are a twink, you will either a) find a sugar daddy b) get raped by a bear in that tiny bathroom c) want to get raped by a bear in that tiny bathroom d) get visually raped
author: Allen L.

description: I spent 6 days in San Francisco trying to find a bar that felt like me.  This bar was just nice.  No gimmick, no strange themes, just good men, good atmosphere.  A real bar.
author: Clint S.

description: Oh my god I've never been in such a tightly packed man-crowd without a glimpse of another woman ANYWHERE!!! I felt awkward at first, but then met some nice drunk guys who were tickled to see a woman in the place. I think they felt embarrassed for me. Either that or they were jealous of my shoes.
author: Chantal H.

description: This place used to be Daddy's... Before I ever went, I always found it very scary: with its husky hairy leather-toting guys hanging out in the front, and its dark and ominous entrance. Then my friend talked me into going in, and it wasn't that bad. Sure, as a twenty-something you'll get a lot of attention (more than desired?), and it's not exactly my crowd, but people are friendly overall. Pretty cruisy place, though, I must say. Highlight of the bar: the giant mirror right above the urinals, oriented just so as to give a perfect view of your fellow guests's attributes.
author: David S.

description: Creepy vindictive manager no-one seems to care for.  Heard many stories from former workers of the 440.  Ye shall reap what ye sow, buddy.
author: Cabron B.

description: I came with my gay friends, again I was the one and ONLY woman. I give you an extra star because they shot MONEY out of these guns today out of no where! Money flying everywhere!! I grabbed what I could, a whole $3! Woohoo felt like I won at Vegas haha. My friend got a $5 bill and $2 Woohoo!!
author: Karen T.

description: My boyfriend liked the pinball machine here. I'm usually okay with being the only woman in a gay bar (i'm a guys girl) but the vibe at Daddy's was defenitely very penis oriented so I would not recommend it for a hag outing.
author: Maria D.

description: 440 Whoot Whoot! Love me some daddy bears! The best part about 440 is there is no stuck up attitude...cool bar tenders and plenty of wild life inside...definatly recommend
author: John H.

description: Lots of leather (more as an accoutrement rather than a lifestyle) and even more attitude, some of it from the bartenders, who should know better if they're relying on tips.  A very cruisey crowd, and therefore unfriendly if they're not interested. I'm surprised Maria D made it through the door.  Earns a star for its contributions to the community.
author: Gourmet G.

description:
went here for frat night once, and it was just.... amazing.  $3 beer bongs?  i think i had six of them.... and my friend at some point said "ok Caleb, no more hard liquor for me, ok?" then two seconds later they announced $3 jaeger shots, and her resolution went out the window... amazing.

I give 3 stars, because I don't actually like the bar that much.  It's tiny and crowded, and the older guys who frequent are usually kind of mean to me....  but I love frathouse!
author: Caleb D.

description:
i have really come to enjoy 440. i mean sure when i was 17, 18, 19 this place wouldnt have been my first choice, but then i turned 22, and realized that badlands isnt the answer to my lifes problems. maybe, just maybe 440 is? hum interesting. BUT in all honesty i would say i go to 440 1 in the 30 times that i go to badlands or the bar. still i do enjoy it when i go. maybe thats because i am so shit faced, i say "lets go to 440!" who really knows.
i have begun to enjoy wednesday nights though. Frathouse. hum interesting again... its a cool mix because you have the really young crowd and then you have the little older mature crowd on the otherside. its the best of both worlds! i enjoy the crowd for sure!
author: Ryan B.

description: I LOVE ME SOME GAY BOYS!!! I was here on Sunday afternoon preparing to go on a bus bday party.  Good times to be had here, I even got the special bathroom key as I am a delicate flower.  Full bar, bar tenders were super cool, and it was bear Sunday! Who knew?  I would for sure go back for $2 beer.  Even my super tall way strait date has a killer time and we all ended up back here after the bus had whipped us around the city for 5 hrs.  Yes yes yes to 440!
author: Nicole F.

description: Miss calling it Daddy's, but a chill bar, go in Wednesday's for Brad night! I mean Frathouse :)
author: Sean M.

description: I have grown to really like this place.  The crowd is a little older (well my age) and they are friendly.  The music ranges from really good to awesome at times.
author: Sean O.

description: The first time I ever saw a mirrored urinal was at this place. I wish it was still called Daddys. It was kind of fun to say that you went to a bar called Daddys some night.
author: John T.

description: Daddy's (oh, sorry, 440) offers a pleasant alternative to the more popular Castro bars. This definitely isn't your typical Kylie-spinning, shade-throwing "boi" bar. Changing the name might have made it sound more mainstream and--I guess--accessible to the toddler set, but I for one am glad there's a place that's more focused to a more masculine 30+ crowd. Definitely a white elephant in the Castro these days.
author: Aaron L.

description: It has been a decline since it ditched the name Daddys, but lately it has been on a steep downhill decline.  Surly employees, severe and annoying or annoyed patrons, bartenders trying to short change you in change to gain more money... just isn't any fun any longer...  Drinks have always been poor and I use to have pronunciation wars with the back bartender always on how to pronounce hefeweizen which he said wrong and would repeat it to me wrong multiple times when I ordered it to argue with my saying it and the fact I pronounced it correctly. I learned to pronounce it from a German speaker which is also confirmed online by doing a quick pronunciation search...  Well he I think is even gone these days too.  Also saw the door man have a freak out on someone last week for what seemed no reason.  Just bad vibes and a bad time for all these days...  Bounced my above thoughts off friends and most agree... Must be the new owner I heard took over and his way of running things...
author: Joseph F.

description: It's my go to bar.  The drinks are resonably priced and the folk are friendly.  The music isn't too loud and it's not too crowded but there are definately folk there.  The crowd is quite diverse with a little something for everyone's taste.  Younger, older, richer, poorer, everyone seems to be here, though not always together on the same night. The bartenders are friendly and attractive and the vibe is very positive.  The weekend and Thursday night can be VERY busy so be prepared to spill some of your drink.  Monday night is Underwear night.  It's gone downhill, they need to make the back bar underwear compulsary and kick out the gropers.
author: Michael D.

description: stinky and full of sweaty men. but they let me use the bathroom without buying a drink. AND a guy let me go ahead of him in line. a gentleman's bar, apparently.
author: Laura S.

description: Daddy's has transformed! Awesome DJ, sexy club nights, hot batenders, and right in the Castro. Still not much fun for the ladies, however.
author: Billy A.

description: low key, funny bartenders, no pretense of badlands, and $2 bud lights on tap!  came here on a sunday afternoon with some friends and definitely had a good time.  i'll definitely come back again, but it's definitely not my crowd and it's incredibly dark inside for a Sunday afternoon.
author: Ben T.

description: Thought not much of a bar guy, like this place because all are welcome, does not have the airs it used to, and the bar staff -- especially that crazy danc'n hunk at the back bar -- make it one of the friendliest places in town.
author: Eric P.

description: 2.5 stars really. Rougher-looking daddy types in this leather bar. The decor is old and butch, but it's not like you can see it. Went here last night, it's pitch-black with only electric red lighting. It's a wonder I wasn't groped, but then again, I wasn't at N-Grope. Monday is underwear night, and first Wednesdays have a decent DJ (I heard him DJ at a Bevan Dufty fundraiser, he was actually decent). Only went here because a friend wanted to. Don't think I'll be going back, at least not on my own. The music I heard on a Thursday night sucked too. That said, I did see a flyer for a Goldfrapp cd release party, so it seems varied. YMMV. And yeah, you won't see any women here (str8 or lesbian).
author: Hao L.

description: I went to this bar 3 times while I was visiting here back in May.  The first time I went was on Monday-- underwear night.  The back room had some action going on, but I did not partake.  (Really, I didn't.)  Crowd was pretty much the same when I went on a Saturday night.  Daddy types.  Lots of guys with goatees.  Not as raw as The Eagle Tavern, but definitely not a circuit boi kind of place.  I met these 2 Irish guys there a couple of times.  But I give this place only 3 stars.  Because the pinball machine was broken.  And the bartenders at this bar weren't particularly friendly.  One of them will shoo you away if you stand where he likes to sell beer.  Oh, and also Daddy's is a much better name than 440 Castro.
author: Flip C.

description: Had a great time there last Sunday.  The cover was something like $1.  The patrions were very friendly was the bar staff.  You get exactly what you expect to get on this - a lot of people standing around drinking and checking each other out.  If you don't like a dark bar with a lot of different types of people or if you frighten easily, this isn't your place.  Less attitude than many other gay bars.
author: Ted G.

description: I like this place...."two buck tuesdays" are a favorite of mine....low key bearish crowd, no attitude, just people gettin' their drink on.... The bartenders are always friendly...and remember my "rocky mountain martinis" (beer with three olives in it).  A good watering hole for the locals...
author: Blake J.

description: 440 Castro, nee Daddy's, nee The Bear is fairly fun, particularly if you happen to be there when it's a rugby fund raiser. Still has that weirdly proportioned leather "hottie" cut out of plywood near the toilets, an image of a man that I have never seen at this establishment regardless of its incarnation.  The DJs can be pretty booming, which is a gigantic plus in tritzy gay disco-centric Castro.  There's a really hot bartender who mans the back bar, don't know his name but he used to work at that packaging store down on Howard Street near 9th, so tell him I said hello even though he doesn't know who I am. yet.
author: Kevin M.

description: the go-go dancer gave me a few winks and a kiss on the cheek. and this was before i gave him a dollar.
author: Jamie C.

description: First off, I have to say most of the reviews of this place seem a little unrealistic.  If you don't personally like the decor, the atmosphere, the crowd, etc, then why are you there reviewing it in the first place?  I don't personally like the Badlands, but I wouldn't give it a negative review based on my dislike of the crowd.  I suppose to a degree the bar decides the clients, but if the Badlands crowd all decided collectively that they were only going to 440 from here on out then I'd not like 440 much anymore.  I used to like the Daddy's crowd, if for no other reason than it was more accessible to me than the outfit and attitude crowd elsewhere.  I was a little unsure about the change when 440 got going, but it was a good change.  Without chasing away the old crowd (Well, other than a few who probably belong at a sex club anyway), they have given it a much more lively atmosphere without loosing the Joe Average feel that made it a favorite in the first place.  The bartenders are usually pretty friendly, though like anyone else, some of them have their moments.   If I was slinging beers to obnoxious drunks on a Friday night at 1:30, I might be a little cranky too (ok, I'd probably be more than a little).  The only reason I don't give a 5 star is that the First Faggot night smacks of an attempt to be something the bar is not.  It is as if the Badlands decided to have a Bear Night once a month.  I think it probably started off differently, but it just feels like they are trying to say 'Regular crowd :  Don't come tonight'.  Other than that I still love the place.  I just wish the whiny neighbors would let them reopen the patio to the public (OK, if I lived there, I'd be a whiny neighbor too, but come on...you moved in above a bar.  Hello?)
author: Allan H.

description: being female...i know i don't belong here.  but i ended up here last night with my homeboy.  and it was great.  i gots a bud light from the bar and settled right in. it was wall to wall guys and i was one of two women in there.  and i was made to feel welcome and special.   maybe because my hair was crimped.  i should crimp it more often.
author: Katie H.

description: I have to borrow Chris T's mantra, that everyone needs their "your" places. Daddies' is definitely one of those spots, more times than not in the short time I have lived here, the text from friends reads "meet me at 440". Whenever people drag me around the 'stro I don't mind because I know that I can always pop into Daddies while they are crammed into Badlands or Midnight Sun. There are many regulars here that are definitely worth taking some time  to have a chat with. I have never really encountered attitude here, never seen anyone get aggressive(in a bad way, lol), and the crowds are usually right up my alley (yes, sometimes literally...underwear night on Monday can get crazy!). I always meet someone new when I'm there and I usually always run into them again next time I'm there. The bartenders are extremely friendly, the barbacks are too, and they have great drink specials ($2 Tuesdays, come on!). The crowds can be pretty packed depending on the weekend and if there are coinciding events happening in the city, but seeing as I how I tend to go out on weekdays and Sundays, I usually find myself with plenty of room to move around but then again I typically don't mind what I'm brushing up against if it's crowded. My only complaint about this bar would be the music. Sometimes it's ok, but it totally random most of the time, it would be a lot better if I was dj-ing there.
author: Thomas K.

description: This bar is in the middle of a transformation, but I still see the same crowd everytime I go, which isn't all that attractive. It's like they're trying to bring in younger guys, but it's not working except for Faggot. The music is good and not loud so it's a nice place to just hang out and drink with friends.
author: Michael G.

description: i went here last wednesday for the frathouse nite. it was a special frathouse nite, where it was the dvd release party for the falcon film endless crush. since it was called frathouse, i expected a younger crowd, but it was older. maybe cuz it was the day before thanksgiving. the youngest people were those of us who went to support my friend who was in the movie and djing a set. it was very crowded and no one dances. maybe actually we didnt have room to dance. the music was a background for people yelling. there were beer bongs but i didnt see anyone drink from them. its very much a bar and not a club, not a place to go dance. it's hard to even walk, and not cuz im a girl, the guys couldnt walk anywhere either. maybe its different on a non holiday week. who knows. anyways, it seems a good place to go drink and chat if you're a middle aged to older guy. and sometimes they have cool falcon/naked sword events. :)  oh, cover on wednesdays is usually $1, but it was $5 for this special event.
author: Merredith L.
